intro: Pleurothyrium oblongum, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves and striking inflorescence. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a spadix, typical of the arum family. Its rhizomes are often harvested for their starchy roots, which are used in culinary applications. Pleurothyrium oblongum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests.
